results.title: On perspective and motion
results.brief_description: “Using the signature gridwork of alleyways of Melbourne city as a device to explore alternative representations of scale and space, this time-lapse portrait of Melbourne explores the traffic flows; human, vehicular and meterological. One of the main aims of my artistic research is to explore new ways of perceiving the world we inhabit. By using machines to work outside of ‘realtime’ I hope to expose new modes of perception and uncover new forms of spatio/temporal representation. To this end I have developed systems for the control and manipulation of both spatial and temporal ‘camera’ positioning. Accurate and repeatable motion control combined with non linear frame capture and sophisticated digital post production provide the freedom to explore alternative visual representations of space/time, isolating and exaggerating the interwoven physical variables that construct perspective and motion.” Daniel Crooks, 2004

results.title: On parade. No. 10. The Army was ready
results.brief_description: The film shows the work of the army during the Hunter Valley floods of 1954 which necessitated the almost complete evacuation of the city of Maitland in collaboration with the Navy and Air Force. In the aftermath the army contributed to the tremendous task of cleaning up, restoring communications and repairing water, electrical and sewage facilities in a race against time to prevent the outbreak of disease.

results.title: On our selection
results.creator_credit: Bert Bailey, Ken G. Hall and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: The first Dad and Dave ‘talkie’ based on the long running stage hit that was derived from the stories of Steele Rudd. The play was a huge success with Depression audiences and in his screen adaptation, Ken Hall stressed the characters’ abilities to fight back against adversity. An early Australian classic.

results.title: On our own
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew, Michele Renaud-Molnar, Kathleen Shannon and Laurette Deschamps
results.brief_description: Women have not been encouraged by society to take charge of their lives, either financially or psychologically. In Canada, three out of every five poor adults are women. This film attempts to explain why by singling out two women. One divorced, the other widowed, they found themselves in financial difficulty; neither was trained for wage-earning work. This documentary outlines some of the resources available. A counsellor at the Montreal Women’s Referral and Information Centre emphasizes the need for long-range financial planning.

results.title: On nature's trail
results.creator_credit: Jason Rosenfield and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Four young nature enthusiasts meet each Saturday morning in their local park where they let their imagination roam free, while learning many principles of ecology as they relate to everyday life. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students.

results.title: On N'enterre Pas le Dimanche = No Funeral on Sundays
results.brief_description:
Philippe, a West Indian student, helps his Swedish girfriend, Margaretha, find a job as a secretary in a publishing house. Philippe has written a novel and the publisher’s wife promise to help with the publishing of the novel in exchange for some special favours from Philippe. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc 1959.

Credits: Director, Michel Drach ; writers, Eric Ollivier, Michel Drach ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Eric Dixon, Kenny Clarke.
Cast: Christina Bendz, Philippe Mory, Hella Petri, Albert Gilou, Marcel Cuvelier.

results.title: On my own
results.creator_credit: Ellepi Films, Alliance Communications, Rosa Colosimo Productions, Les Pescarolo, Elisa Resegotti and Antonio Tibaldi
results.brief_description: Simon (Matthew Ferguson), an adolescent at an elite Canadian boarding school, is looking forward to spending his Christmas holidays with his divorced parents. When he arrives in Toronto he discovers that his mother has been hospitalised and, for the first time, is told of her schizophrenia. This intimate drama, shot in the beautiful light of a north Canadian winter, is powerfully acted by Ferguson and by Judy Davis as the mother. Simon’s growing awareness of his mother’s illness results in his alienation from the concerns of his fellow classmates, and he becomes close to an older boy who initiates him into the rites of adulthood. This Australian, Canadian and Italian co-production was nominated for 6 AFI awards including Best Film.

results.title: On Mediterranean shores: Southern Greece
results.creator_credit: Louis De Rochemont, Louis de Rochemont Associates and John Ferno
results.brief_description: Modern Greece, the end product of a civilisation 3000 years old, is a poor country. It is a mountainous peninsula and its towns and cities are scattered along the seacoast and its many islands. The film introduces us to Constantine, a boatowner, who carries cargo between the island and the coastal cities. We follow Constantine on his journey from the island to the coastal cities visiting small villages and Pireus, the port of Athens.
